ovdesc.p: This table enables definition of charges for clients (non banks)
Charges can be defined for both debit and credit parties based on the direction of the message.

desc.p: Holds the minimum charge amount for the specific fee type. If the charge amount is calculated as a percentage
of the transaction amount and if it falls below the amount specified here, the fee amount applied would be the amount
specified in this field
In case of variable fee this will be defined as the percentage (up to 9 decimal places)
Fixed positive amount which would be added to charge amount in case of percentage charge.
Fixed positive amount which would be deducted from charge amount in case of percentage charge
Fixed positive amount which could be added to the calculated Fee (fixed or variable) to arrive at the final fee.
Unique ID to identify the Client Charges Fee Formula
Unique ID to identify the Client Charges Fee Type
There could be different charges based on the transaction amount. We can define various amount tiers and different charge amount for each tier
This field holds the transaction amount tier.
For the following configuration of 0, 500 and 1500
0 - Covers form 0 until 499
500 - Covers form 500 until 999
1000 - Covers form 1000 and above
Based on the transaction amount, the appropriate tier will be chosen.
Holds the fixed positive amount in the Fee type currency. Fee amount could be entered up to two decimal places
System generated id for the table PPL.CLIENTCHARGESFORMULA
Holds the maximum charge amount for the specific fee type. If the charge amount is calculated as a percentage
of the transaction amount and if it exceeds the amount specified here, the fee amount is capped to the amount
specified in this field
